TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PageAdapter extends System.Web.UI.Adapters.ControlAdapter
Public MustInherit Class PageAdapter Inherits ControlAdapter
public ref class PageAdapter abstract : System::Web::UI::Adapters::ControlAdapter

Docs.summary: Adapts a Web page for a specific browser and provides the base class from which all page adapters inherit, directly or indirectly.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class is an abstract class that adapts a Web page for a specific class of browsers, defined by the markup language that the browser uses (for example, HTML or XHTML). Much of the adaptability in rendering behavior can be encapsulated in the specialized text writer classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class, so it is not always necessary to provide a page adapter.
Most members of derived page adapters are called from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or from control adapters. First, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or control adapters detect the presence of the derived page adapter, and then call the member, or provide the functionality if the page adapter is not present.
The members of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByParams%2A> properties define additional HTTP headers and HTTP `GET` and `POST` parameters that can be used to vary caching. They are called during cache initialization from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method returns an object that can be used to persist the combined view and control states of the page. It is referenced from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.PageStatePersister%2A> property if a derived page adapter is present.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetPostBackFormReference%2A> method provides a DHTML code fragment that can be used to reference forms in scripts.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method returns a collection of the postback variables if the page is in postback. It is called by the .NET Framework instead of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.DeterminePostBackMode%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method if a derived page adapter is present.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderEndHyperlink%2A> methods are used by control adapters to render hyperlinks if a derived page adapter is present.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method renders a hyperlink or postback client tag that can submit the form.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetRadioButtonsByGroup%2A> methods are used by radio button control adapters to reference the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.ClientState%2A> property provides access to the combined control and view states of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object through the internal `ClientState` property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> method is used by control adapters to perform device-specific text transformation.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a class named `CustomPageAdapter` from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method adds an attribute named `src` to a hyperlink, which contains a reference to the current page. All hyperlinks rendered in pages to which `CustomPageAdapter` is attached will have the `src` attribute.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink/CS/pageadapter.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink/VB/pageadapter.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework constructs this adapter internally when it creates the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class or derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied for the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
Docs.value: An that contains a list of HTTP headers; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Entities on the Web that cache Web pages cache multiple versions, based on the HTTP headers and other factors. For example, a version for each language in which a page is generated is typically cached, based on the `Accept-Language` HTTP header.
For specific browsers, it might be necessary to vary caching by HTTP headers in addition to the headers that control target-independent caching. For example, it might be necessary to cache different versions of a page for different screen sizes.
The header names returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> property are added to the list of headers on the `Vary` HTTP header sent to the client browser.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the property to return a list of the additional headers to control target-specific caching. The base property returns .

Docs.related: How to: Cache Versions of a Page, Based on HTTP Headers

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection CacheVaryByParams { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection CacheVaryByParams
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property CacheVaryByParams As StringCollection
public: virtual property System::Collections::Specialized::StringCollection ^ CacheVaryByParams { System::Collections::Specialized::StringCollection ^ get(); };
member this.CacheVaryByParams : System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a list of additional parameters from HTTP GET and POST requests by which caching is varied for the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
Docs.value: An that contains a list of the GET and POST parameters; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Entities on the Web that cache Web pages cache multiple versions based on, among other factors, the request parameters. For example, a version for each store location within a retail chain for which a page might be generated would typically be cached based on the parameter name (for example, `StoreID`).
For specific browsers, it might be necessary to vary caching by GET or POST parameters in addition to the parameters that control target-independent caching. For example, it might be necessary to cache different versions of a page for different mobile phone service providers.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the property to return a list of the additional GET or POST parameters to control target-specific caching. The base method returns .

Docs.related: How to: Cache Versions of a Page, Based on Parameters

Docs.summary: Gets an encoded string that contains the view and control states data of the Web page to which this derived page adapter is attached.
Docs.value: An encoded containing the combined view and control states of the controls on the associated .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.ClientState%2A> property provides access to the internal `ClientState` property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
View state data stored by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> object in the internal `ClientState` property of <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> will always be saved in the hidden field on the Web page.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you cannot override the property because it is not . To modify the behavior of in a derived class, implement a new property that references the property of the base class.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the Web page is in postback and returns a name/value collection of the postback variables.
Docs.returns: A of the postback variables, if any; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method returns one of the following collections:
- Form variables if the HTTP data transfer method is `POST`.
- Query string variables if the HTTP method is `GET`.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the method to provide target-specific handling of the postback variables collection.

Docs.summary: Returns a name-value collection of data that was posted to the page using either a POST or a GET command, without performing ASP.NET request validation on the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UnvalidatedRequestValues> class.

Docs.param: A containing the client ID of the form that was posted.
Docs.summary: Returns a DHTML code fragment that the client browser can use to reference the form on the page that was posted.
Docs.returns: A with a reference to the form on the page that was posted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetPostBackFormReference%2A> method provides a DHTML reference to the postback form. The code fragment has the following format:
`document.forms['` `formID` `']`

block.para:
When you inherit from the class, you can override the method if the markup for the browser supported by the adapter requires a different format for the postback form reference. For example, the HTML 3.2 standard used by PocketPC browsers requires the following format:
document.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister GetStatePersister() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetStatePersister () As PageStatePersister
public: virtual System::Web::UI::PageStatePersister ^ GetStatePersister();
abstract member GetStatePersister : unit -> System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister override this.GetStatePersister : unit -> System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister

Docs.summary: Returns an object that is used by the Web page to maintain the control and view states.
Docs.returns: An object derived from that supports creating and extracting the combined control and view states for the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.PageStatePersister%2A> property uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetStatePersister%2A> method to return the object, derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class, that forms and extracts the combined control and view states for the page. If there is no derived page adapter attached to the page, a <xref:System.Web.UI.HiddenFieldPageStatePersister> object is used to maintain the state in a hidden field on the page.
|Link type|Resulting link| |---------------|--------------------| |Code Entity Reference,cer|<xref:System.Char.ToString%2A>| |Code Entity Reference Qualified, cerq|<xref:System.Char.ToString%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>| |Code Entity Reference Specific,cers|<xref:System.Char.ToString%28System.Char%29>| |Code Entity Reference Qualified Specific, cerqs|<xref:System.Char.ToString%28System.Char%29?displayProperty=nameWithType>|

block.para: View state data stored by the object in the internal property of the will always be saved in the hidden field on the Web page.

When you inherit from the class, you can override the method to return another derived page state persister if it is not feasible to maintain the combined state in a hidden field (for example, because of limited resources).
The base class returns a object. You can use the class to maintain the page state in session state.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RegisterRadioButton (System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton radioButton);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterRadioButton(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton radioButton) cil managed
public: virtual void RegisterRadioButton(System::Web::UI::WebControls::RadioButton ^ radioButton);
abstract member RegisterRadioButton : System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton -> unit override this.RegisterRadioButton : System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton -> unit

Docs.param: The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a radio button control to the collection for a specified radio button group.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> object to maintain a list of radio button groups. Each element in <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> is a collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> method adds a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control to the appropriate collection, creating the collection if it does not already exist, and creating <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.ListDictionary> if there are no previously registered <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls.
Radio button control adapters use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RegisterRadioButton%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.GetRadioButtonsByGroup%2A> methods to reference the other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> controls in a radio button group.

Docs.summary: Renders an opening hyperlink tag that includes the target URL to the response stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method writes an opening hyperlink tag. When `writer` is <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter>, this tag has the following format:
`<a href="` `targetUrl` `">`
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a class named `CustomPageAdapter` from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter> class and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink%2A> method adds an attribute named `src` to a hyperlink, which contains a reference to the current page. All hyperlinks rendered in pages to which `CustomPageAdapter` is attached will have the `src` attribute.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink/CS/pageadapter.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderBeginHyperlink/VB/pageadapter.vb#1)]

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the method to write a different format for an opening hyperlink tag or to write additional tag attributes. For example, the base method does not write an attribute for .

Docs.summary: Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded and possibly encrypted view state, and event target and argument.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the method if a different format is required for the postback event hyperlink or the browser has other unique requirements. For example, some browsers require the hyperlink text to be nonempty if the link is to render. You can also override if limited resources prevent including the view state as a URL parameter. The base method does not write an attribute for .

Docs.summary: Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded and possibly encrypted view state, an event target and argument, a previous-page parameter, and an access key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink, including the possibly chunked <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.UrlEncode%2A> view state, `__EVENTTARGET=target`, `__EVENTARGUMENT=argument`, `__PREVIOUSPAGE=currentFilePath` parameters, and an `accessKey="accessKey"` attribute.
View state is encrypted if the `enableViewStateMac` attribute of the [pages Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4123bb66-3fe4-4d62-b70e-33758656b458) configuration element is set to `true`.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the method if a different format is required for the postback event hyperlink or the browser has other unique requirements. For example, some browsers require the hyperlink text to be nonempty if the link is to render. You can also override if limited resources prevent including the view state as a URL parameter. The base method does not write an attribute for .

to use & as the URL parameter separator; to use &.
Docs.summary: Renders a postback event into the response stream as a hyperlink, including the encoded view state, an event target and argument, a previous-page parameter, and an access key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.RenderPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a postback event as a scriptless hyperlink, including the possibly chunked <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.UrlEncode%2A> view state, `__EVENTTARGET=target`, `__EVENTARGUMENT=argument`, `__PREVIOUSPAGE=currentFilePath` parameters, and an `accessKey="accessKey"` attribute.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override the method if a different format is required for the postback event hyperlink or the browser has other unique requirements. For example, some browsers require the hyperlink text to be nonempty if the link is to render. You can also override if limited resources prevent including view state as a URL parameter. The base method does not write an attribute for .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string TransformText (string text);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string TransformText(string text) cil managed
Public Overridable Function TransformText (text As String) As String
public: virtual System::String ^ TransformText(System::String ^ text);
abstract member TransformText : string -> string override this.TransformText : string -> string

Docs.param: A that is the text to transform.
Docs.summary: Transforms text for the target browser.
Docs.returns: A that contains the transformed text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> method can be used, for example, to transform tab characters (`\t`) into line breaks (`\n`).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter.TransformText%2A> base method returns `text` unchanged.

block.para: When you inherit from the class, you can override if a particular markup has a construct with a different form from standard HTML. For example, if a browser requires a different identifier for a tag than what would be used in HTML, method can be overridden to find that tag and change it.
